channel.title: Daily News Feed Update #1
channel.description: Daily collected titles from multiple sources

item.title: English Editorials (Update #1) • To end the starvation in Gaza, bring back UNRWA • Protect millions of children from malnutrition

Magazines (Update #1) • Fired CDC Director Susan Monarez Speaks Out on Contentious Tenure under RFK, Jr. • Stunning Cat Photos Reveal Feline Science • Mathematicians Discover Prime Number Pattern in Fractal Chaos • 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine Awarded for Discoveries Key to Treating Autoimmune Disease • Saturn’s Moon Enceladus May Harbor Life. Study Finds Complex Organic Molecules • Galaxies fling out matter much more violently than we thought • General relativity might save some planets from death • What’s my Alzheimer’s risk, and can I really do anything to change it? • Nobel prize for medicine goes to trio for work on immune tolerance • Shackleton knew his doomed ship wasn’t the strongest before sailing • Would a ban on genetic engineering of wildlife hamper conservation?

International (Update #1) • ICC convicts former Sudan militia leader for war crimes in Darfur • Eswatini confirms arrival of 10 more people as part of US deportation deal • Brazil’s president asks US to scrap tariffs in ‘friendly’ call with Trump • Rush reform for first time since drummer Neil Peart’s death • Weather tracker: Typhoon Matmo batters southern China • New Zealand foreign minister Winston Peters’ home vandalised ‘during a protest’ • Mount Everest hikers describe ‘extreme’ conditions as huge rescue effort continues • Gaza flotilla passengers allege poor conditions in detention as Israel prepares to deport dozens of activists • Australia politics live: Liberal MP criticises Hastie and warns party room infighting will leave them like Victorians • Australia Post releases footage of posties being hit by cars as it urges drivers to ‘keep an eye out’ • Man charged over alleged Sydney shooting spree picks barrister to represent him after confusion in court • Western Sydney University graduates sent ‘fraudulent’ emails claiming degrees were ‘revoked’ • Erin Patterson mushroom murders inspire new book by Helen Garner • Man convicted in Gisèle Pelicot case says he ‘never intended’ to rape her • Judge killed in courtroom shooting in Albania • Gaza flotilla members allege beatings and insults in Israeli detention • France is in crisis but bond markets leave other governments at risk of meltdown too • Macron asks outgoing French PM to make last-ditch effort to resolve political crisis • Israel-Hamas ceasefire talks under way; Putin and Netanyahu discussed Trump Gaza plan, says Kremlin – as it happened • Israel and Hamas begin indirect talks as hopes rise of ending Gaza war • ‘We want justice’: workers at Amazon warehouses in Saudi Arabia still waiting on financial redress • Trump urges negotiators to ‘move fast’ as Gaza ceasefire talks set to begin in Egypt • Tory plan to scrap judge-led Sentencing Council criticised as ‘bonkers’ • People claim London crime is rising because it suits them, Met commander says • Tories set a low bar after misspelling Britain on conference chocolate • Bronze age gold jewellery stolen in raid on St Fagans museum in Cardiff • Rugby world rallies round former England captain Lewis Moody after MND diagnosis • New California law bans loud ads on streaming services for ‘peace and quiet’ • Schumer rejects Trump’s claim that bipartisan government shutdown negotiations are under way – as it happened • Trump orders approval of 211-mile mining road through Alaska wilderness • Republicans post fake image of Oregon protest – using photos of South America • Burbank airport with empty air traffic control tower due to US shutdown
Geopolitics (Update #1) • Say Goodbye to the World’s Trade Routes
